body_content.explanation: policies, behaviours, rules, etc. that result in unfair or harmful treatment of disabled people (= people who have an illness, injury, or condition that makes it difficult for them to do things that most other people can do) and in a continued unfair advantage to people who are not disabled:
examples: The organization was fraught with institutionalized ableism.
We are grappling with the challenging legacy of ableism.

body_content.explanation: harmful or unfair things that people say, do, or think based on the belief that disabled people (= people who have an illness, injury, or condition that makes it difficult for them to do things that most other people can do) are not as good as people who are not disabled, or that they do not deserve special arrangements that help them to live their lives and be included in society:
examples: Saying that wheelchair users all have miserable lives is an example of ableism.
We will not tolerate ableism in this community.
